TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit StandardPrintController extends System.Drawing.Printing.PrintController

Docs.summary: Specifies a print controller that sends information to a printer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument> uses this class.
For more information on printing, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace overview.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void OnEndPage (System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument document, System.Drawing.Printing.PrintPageEventArgs e);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void OnEndPage(class System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument document, class System.Drawing.Printing.PrintPageEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: A that represents the document being printed.
A that contains data about how to print a page in the document.
Docs.summary: Completes the control sequence that determines when and how to print a page of a document.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPage%2A> is called immediately after the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument> raises the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument.PrintPage> event. If an exception is thrown inside a <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument.PrintPage> event of a <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument>, <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPage%2A> is not called.
<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> creates the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object that is sent to the printer. After <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> is called, the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPage%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object to a graphic of a single page. The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPage%2A> method clears the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object, while the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPrint%2A> method deallocates the object.
When <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPage%2A> is called from a printing context of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog> a <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintingPermission> of <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintingPermissionLevel.SafePrinting> is required. Printing to the default printer requires a <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintingPermission> of <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintingPermissionLevel.DefaultPrinting>. All other calls this method requires a <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintingPermission> of <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintingPermissionLevel.AllPrinting>

Docs.exception: The native Win32 Application Programming Interface (API) could not finish writing to a page.
Docs.permission: for controlling access to printers. Related enumeration: .

MemberSignature.Value: public override void OnEndPrint (System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument document, System.Drawing.Printing.PrintEventArgs e);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void OnEndPrint(class System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument document, class System.Drawing.Printing.PrintEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: A that represents the document being printed.
A that contains data about how to print the document.
Docs.summary: Completes the control sequence that determines when and how to print a document.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPrint%2A> is called immediately after <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument> raises the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument.EndPrint> event. Even if an uncaught exception was thrown during the printing process, <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPrint%2A> is called.
<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> creates the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object that is sent to the printer. After <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> is called, the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPage%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object to a graphic of a single page. The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPage%2A> method clears the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object, while the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPrint%2A> method deallocates the object.

Docs.exception:
The native Win32 Application Programming Interface (API) could not complete the print job.
-or-
The native Win32 API could not delete the specified device context (DC).
Docs.permission: for controlling access to printers. Related enumeration: .

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Drawing.Graphics OnStartPage (System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument document, System.Drawing.Printing.PrintPageEventArgs e);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Drawing.Graphics OnStartPage(class System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument document, class System.Drawing.Printing.PrintPageEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: A that represents the document being printed.
A that contains data about how to print a page in the document. Initially, the property of this parameter will be . The value returned from the method will be used to set this property.
Docs.summary: Begins the control sequence that determines when and how to print a page in a document.
Docs.returns: A object that represents a page from a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPage%2A> is called immediately before <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument> raises the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument.PrintPage> event.
<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> creates the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object used in printing. After <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> is called, the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPage%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object to a graphic of a single page. The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPage%2A> method clears the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object, while the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPrint%2A> method deallocates the object.

Docs.exception:
The native Win32 Application Programming Interface (API) could not prepare the printer driver to accept data.
-or-
The native Win32 API could not update the specified printer or plotter device context (DC) using the specified information.
Docs.permission: for controlling access to printers. Related enumeration: .

MemberSignature.Value: public override void OnStartPrint (System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument document, System.Drawing.Printing.PrintEventArgs e);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void OnStartPrint(class System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument document, class System.Drawing.Printing.PrintEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: A that represents the document being printed.
A that contains data about how to print the document.
Docs.summary: Begins the control sequence that determines when and how to print a document.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> is called immediately after <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument> raises the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument.BeginPrint> event.
<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> creates the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object used in printing. After <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> is called, the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPage%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object to a graphic of a single page. The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPage%2A> method clears the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object, while the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnEndPrint%2A> method deallocates the object.
<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.StandardPrintController.OnStartPrint%2A> verifies that the printer settings are valid.

Docs.exception: The printer settings are not valid.
The native Win32 Application Programming Interface (API) could not start a print job.
Docs.permission: for controlling access to printers. Related enumeration:
